column4: hi i can install the USB creator in a KDE live session but i cannot start it
What happens when you try to start it?
Do you have a Windows installation available?
http://paste.ubuntu.com:80/201141/
i do but since i lost grub when the installer erased the partition
Okay, hang on
i have a working KDE , just doesnt install
Are you using Kubuntu?
yes
okay, this is a known bug, but try this: sudo apt-get install python-gnome2, then try running usb creator again
its installing..
is there no method (via CLI) to make a bootable USB drive , i have the ISO on the HD
Well, there is, but I'd recommend you stick with this for the most reliable results.
ok
Installing python-gnome2 should fix the usb creator in kubuntu
ok
Has it finished installing?
i have a slow net connection.... please wait another 3 min
np
could you point me to the bug report??
Sure. https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/usb-creator/+bug/316077
